adjectives.description: pikey (comparative more pikey, superlative most pikey)

entries.meaning: Associated with or filled with pike (fish).

examples: In 1876, in twelve fishings in the same months, there were caught 31 Pikeys, 4 Spotted Dogs, and 441 Nowds.

description: Possibly from obsolete pike (“depart or travel”), or possibly from turnpike. The verb is derived from the stereotype that the Romani people or other travellers are thieves.

adjectives.description: pikey (comparative more pikey, superlative most pikey)

entries.meaning: (UK, slang, derogatory) Associated with members of the above-mentioned underclass.
examples: Blimey. The least pikey place on the planet.

entries.meaning: (UK, Ireland, ethnic slur, offensive) An itinerant person, especially one of Romani or Irish Traveller heritage.
(UK, Ireland, derogatory, offensive) A working-class (often underclass) person with negative connotations of benefit fraud, theft and living on rundown estates.

verbs.description: pikey (third-person singular simple present pikeys, present participle pikeying, simple past and past participle pikeyed)

examples: >It's getting hold of a copy that isn't pikeyed that I'm having >difficulty with :-(
